messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hi, I need the police to come to my house right away.
My daughter's boyfriend is here.
He's in the room, and he has a gun.
I have a restraining order against him, and he's not supposed to be here.
He's in our apartment.
Hello?
He's in the room right now, and he has a gun.
He has a gun in his pocket, and he's in one of our bedrooms.
What's he doing with the gun?
He held it up to my daughter's head and is threatening her.
He's in our apartment and won't get out.
Okay, what's your name?
Ma'am, I'm going to get some information from you. I want you to stay on the phone with me, okay?
Okay.
Did you see him take the gun out?
No, I just got home and he's here. He's locked himself in.
How do you know that he has a gun?
He's here. Do you want to talk to my daughter?
I thought she was in the room with him.
No, we're in a separate bedroom.
Okay. Let me talk to her.
Hello?
Hi, does he have a gun?
Yes, ma'am.
Okay, did he hold it to your head?
Yes, ma'am. I have a restraining order against him, and he's not supposed to be here.
How did you get away from him?
We were just talking and then he put it down. I was trying to be nice and say I would do what he said.
What room are you all locked in?
We're locked in my mom's room.
But I have a restraining order against him, and he's not supposed to be around me and my kids.
I was trying to be nice and let him talk to the kids, but he took it too far.
What's your name?
What's your date of birth, sweetie?
January 28, 1987.
Where did you see him put the gun?
He put it back in his pocket, his right pocket I think.
Is he still in your bedroom?
Yes, ma'am.
Can you describe what your boyfriend is wearing?
He's wearing a black shirt.
What about his pants?
Long black shorts.
Long black shorts?
Yes, ma'am.
Is he wearing sandals?
Yes, ma'am.
What's his name? Is he white, black, or Hispanic?
He's black.
Do you know his date of birth?
Do you know what kind of gun it is?
I don't know anything about guns.
Is it a black gun, a silver gun?
It was a little handgun.
Where are you going, Mommy? No, stay. What if he finds you?
I have officers in the area, but I need you all to stay in one room, so I know where everybody's at.
Okay.
Stay here, she said stay.
If I'm at your front door, where is he in relation to the house?
Once you come in the door, you go around by the TV and make a right. It's the first door straight ahead.
You said past the TV?
Yes, once you come in, the TV is on your right. Then there's a hallway to the right, keep going straight to the first door.
Where are you in relation to the front door?
He's in here. Hurry up, please.
Okay, what's he doing?
